metadata.title: CVE-2023-52434 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: smb:client: fix potential OOBs in smb2_parse_contexts() Validate offsets andlengths before dereferencing create contexts in smb2_parse_contexts(). Thisfixes following oops when accessing invalid create contexts from server:BUG: unable to handle page fault for address: ffff8881178d8cc3 #PF:supervisor read access in kernel mode #PF: error_code(0x0000) - not-presentpage PGD 4a01067 P4D 4a01067 PUD 0 Oops: 0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP NOPTI CPU: 3PID: 1736 Comm: mount.cifs Not tainted 6.7.0-rc4 #1 Hardware name: QEMUStandard PC (Q35 + ICH9, 2009), BIOSrel-1.16.2-3-gd478f380-rebuilt.opensuse.org 04/01/2014 RIP:0010:smb2_parse_contexts+0xa0/0x3a0 [cifs] Code: f8 10 75 13 48 b8 93 ad 2550 9c b4 11 e7 49 39 06 0f 84 d2 00 00 00 8b 45 00 85 c0 74 61 41 29 c5 4801 c5 41 83 fd 0f 76 55 <0f> b7 7d 04 0f b7 45 06 4c 8d 74 3d 00 66 83 f804 75 bc ba 04 00 RSP: 0018:ffffc900007939e0 EFLAGS: 00010216 RAX:ffffc90000793c78 RBX: ffff8880180cc000 RCX: ffffc90000793c90 RDX:ffffc90000793cc0 RSI: ffff8880178d8cc0 RDI: ffff8880180cc000 RBP:ffff8881178d8cbf R08: ffffc90000793c22 R09: 0000000000000000 R10:ffff8880180cc000 R11: 0000000000000024 R12: 0000000000000000 R13:0000000000000020 R14: 0000000000000000 R15: ffffc90000793c22 FS:00007f873753cbc0(0000) GS:ffff88806bc00000(0000) knlGS:0000000000000000 CS:0010 DS: 0000 ES: 0000 CR0: 0000000080050033 CR2: ffff8881178d8cc3 CR3:00000000181ca000 CR4: 0000000000750ef0 PKRU: 55555554 Call Trace: <TASK> ?__die+0x23/0x70 ? page_fault_oops+0x181/0x480 ?search_module_extables+0x19/0x60 ? srso_alias_return_thunk+0x5/0xfbef5 ?exc_page_fault+0x1b6/0x1c0 ? asm_exc_page_fault+0x26/0x30 ?smb2_parse_contexts+0xa0/0x3a0 [cifs] SMB2_open+0x38d/0x5f0 [cifs] ?smb2_is_path_accessible+0x138/0x260 [cifs]smb2_is_path_accessible+0x138/0x260 [cifs] cifs_is_path_remote+0x8d/0x230[cifs] cifs_mount+0x7e/0x350 [cifs] cifs_smb3_do_mount+0x128/0x780 [cifs]smb3_get_tree+0xd9/0x290 [cifs] vfs_get_tree+0x2c/0x100 ? capable+0x37/0x70path_mount+0x2d7/0xb80 ? srso_alias_return_thunk+0x5/0xfbef5 ?_raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore+0x44/0x60 __x64_sys_mount+0x11a/0x150do_syscall_64+0x47/0xf0 entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x6f/0x77 RIP:0033:0x7f8737657b1e

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
